p: 3. We still do not know why the male gender is more affected than the female gender. Genetic hormonal differences have been reported, and testosterone seems to favor a more severe evolution of the infection in some cases. In this context, females seem to have fewer ACE2 receptors on the lung surface than males and this could contribute, together with some genetic and hormonal factors, to give more protection to SARS-CoV-2 infection and make them less susceptible [ 62]. Studies are underway to support these hypotheses.
